sourceMeaningMnemonic: If <radical>someone</radical> is holding <radical>flowers</radical>, they're probably an <kanji>author</kanji>. Authors really love flowers, because they help them think of flowery language they can use to sound smart in their books.
meaningInfo: Imagine a time when a book you were reading used flowery language and you couldn't understand. Imagine the annoyance with the author for using words that are hard to understand.
readingMnemonic: Unfortunately, the <kanji>author</kanji> is allergic to flowers. They are only allergic to touching them though, so the author is holding the flowers with a pair of <reading>cho</reading>psticks (<ja>ちょ</ja>), really close to their face. Using the chopsticks, they can still use the flowers to think of fancy, author-ly words without touching them.
readingInfo: Picture the author trying to use chopsticks to move around a little flower. It looks like they're having a hard time, but people will do anything to be a great author, I suppose.
